async_info.video_title: EU agrees Brexit extension to 31 January- BBC News
async_info.video_description:
The EU has agreed to extend Brexit until 31 January 2020, according to a tweet from the European Council president.
Donald Tusk said the bloc would allow for a so-called "flextension" - meaning the UK could leave before the deadline if a deal was approved by Parliament.
It comes as MPs prepare to vote on proposals by Boris Johnson for an early general election on 12 December.
The SNP and Lib Dems have also proposed an election on 9 December.
The draft text of an agreement for the 27 EU ambassadors - seen by the BBC - also included a commitment that the Withdrawal Agreement on the UK's exit from the EU cannot be renegotiated in future.
Please subscribe HERE http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

comment_content.original_script:
I dunno why I bother but here we go, once upon a time
Uk:we're leaving
Eu:wait, you're serious? Why? This is the only way we can be powerful enough to face powers like China and the US. Thats a huge blow to Europe as a whole, we're gonna have a difficult year maybe never recover completely, you'd be betraying Ireland to which you have, huh, let's say, historical amends to take care of, but mostly you'd be committing suicide while also having to deal with us anyway but, you know, pissed off and ready to pillage.
Uk:nevertheless
Uk opposition:well that's 4years and 3 prime ministers of realization that we'd be committing suicide, but I'll be damned if I have to tell people that not only are we going back, we'd get a worse deal than we had before. People would flip at just the notion of losing the pound.
Eu:I mean, extensions are fine for me, the uk degrades slowly but we're getting fantastic deals out of it, man, can you believe Boris just gave us 7billion?just gave us, like that! Amazing! Maybe it's not so bad, the uk was already a stick in the mud when turkey and Tunisia wanted to join and that came to bite us as a lost opportunity.
Thus the saga continues

People would flip at just the notion of losing the pound. Eu:I mean, extensions are fine for me, the uk degrades slowly but we're getting fantastic deals out of it, man, can you believe Boris just gave us 7billion?just gave us, like that! Amazing! Maybe it's not so bad, the uk was already a stick in the mud when turkey and Tunisia wanted to join and that came to bite us as a lost opportunity. Thus the saga continues
